title: Compare Renovate config for demo
description: Review the Renovate configuration in the demo repository and compare it with other genai-rs library crates. Identify any settings that block liberal dependency version updates appropriate for published libraries and outline recommended adjustments.
acceptance_criteria:
Report current Renovate settings and differences.
List concrete recommendations for making version policies more permissive where safe.
notes:
2025-10-21: demo repo does not include a Renovate config (no renovate.json/renovate.json5). Renovate therefore falls back to the hosted app defaults and cannot align with the org’s preferred behavior. By contrast, library crates such as openai-ergonomic and langfuse-ergonomic extend `config:recommended`, enable the cargo/github-actions managers, auto-merge grouped patch/minor updates, and tag core dependencies for manual review. langfuse-client-base also uses a regex manager to track the OpenAPI generator Docker image. Recommended follow-ups for demo:
- add a repo-level renovate.json5 that mirrors the shared library baseline (schedule window, labels, grouped patch/minor auto-merges, security fast-track)
- keep `rangeStrategy: update-lockfile` so the application lockfile stays current
- consider whether any critical deps (e.g., Axum, Langfuse/OpenTelemetry crates) should be marked for manual review similar to the library configs.
Until such a config exists, demo will continue relying on Renovate defaults and may miss lockfile bumps or grouped updates.

title: Compare Renovate config for langfuse-client-base

notes:
Analysis complete. Key findings:
- langfuse-client-base has EXEMPLARY config compared to other repos
- rangeStrategy: 'bump' is CORRECT for library crates (openai-ergonomic and langfuse-ergonomic should copy this)
- Only minor improvements needed: bon version format + lockFileMaintenance removal
- Full analysis in RENOVATE_ANALYSIS.md
- PR: https://github.com/genai-rs/langfuse-client-base/pull/91
- Grade: A- (95%)

title: openai-ergonomic: Handle testing_patterns panic when mockito can't bind
description:
Running `cargo run --example testing_patterns` in the openai-ergonomic repository fails early when the example tries to spin up a mockito server. In environments where binding a local TCP listener is not permitted (e.g., sandboxed CI), the example panics with

```
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at .../mockito-1.7.0/src/server.rs:334:56:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Error { kind: ServerFailure, context: Some("Operation not permitted (os error 1)") }
```

We should catch this error and either fall back to a mockless mode or print a friendly message and exit cleanly so the example doesn't crash.

title: Document top-level repositories in AGENTS.md
description: Ensure each top-level git repository in the meta checkout has a concise entry in `AGENTS.md` with its purpose and GitHub URL so contributors can quickly jump into the right project. Cover the repos currently present in the workspace.
acceptance_criteria:
AGENTS.md lists demo, genai-ci-bot, langfuse-client-base, langfuse-ergonomic, langgraph-rs, openai-client-base, openai-ergonomic, opentelemetry-langfuse, and rmcp-demo with succinct purpose notes and GitHub links.
Descriptions reflect current scope/ownership for each repo.

title: demo: Summarize tool UX explorations
description: Create a consolidated write-up covering the recent investigations into improving the developer experience for using tools with openai-ergonomic inside the demo repository. Capture the experiments performed, key findings, recommended patterns, blockers, and follow-up work so future contributors have a single reference.

title: Quickstart streaming example fails to parse SSE responses
description:
Running `cargo run --example quickstart` in openai-ergonomic with valid credentials consistently fails at the "Step 4: Streaming response" section. The example invokes `client.responses().user(...).temperature(0.7).stream(true)` and then `client.send_responses(builder).await`. The request returns an SSE response (`Content-Type: text/event-stream`), but the client attempts to deserialize it as a JSON `CreateChatCompletionResponse`, resulting in:

```
Failed to get streaming response: JSON error: Received `text/event-stream; charset=utf-8` content type response that cannot be converted to `models::CreateChatCompletionResponse`
```

We should update the example (and possibly the client) to handle streaming responses correctly—either by switching to a streaming-aware API or by parsing the SSE stream incrementally. Until then, the Quickstart walkthrough breaks at Step 4.
notes:
Branch pushed to origin: genai-21-openai-ergonomic-streaming-fix
Worktree location: /Users/tim.van.wassenhove/src/genai-rs/worktrees/genai-21-openai-ergonomic-streaming-fix
Commit: 53a5ea5 - fix: use proper streaming API in quickstart example
PR URL suggestion: https://github.com/genai-rs/openai-ergonomic/pull/new/genai-21-openai-ergonomic-streaming-fix

title: openai-ergonomic: Document testing_patterns behavior in restricted envs
description:
When running `cargo run --example testing_patterns` in openai-ergonomic inside a sandbox that blocks opening TCP listeners, the example panics because mockito cannot bind its mock server:

```
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at ...mockito/src/server.rs:334:56:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Error { kind: ServerFailure, context: Some("Operation not permitted (os error 1)") }
```

Create a short section in the README or example docs noting this failure mode, how to detect it, and suggested workarounds (e.g., run with appropriate permissions or skip the mock-server portion).

title: Design unified Tool trait for openai-ergonomic
description: Replace the current Tool/TypedTool/StronglyTypedTool split with a single Tool trait that has customizable input/output associated types while keeping async execution. Draft trait signature, helper type aliases, and migration notes for downstream users.

title: openai-ergonomic: Implement unified Tool API
description: Implement the redesigned Tool trait with configurable input/output types, update ToolRegistry to work with it, and refresh helper macros/docs/examples to match the new unified design.

title: openai-ergonomic: Update macros for unified Tool API
description: Provide a simplified macro interface around the unified Tool trait, replacing the current simple_tool!, tool_schema!, and strongly_typed_tool! trio with a cohesive helper that supports optional typed inputs/outputs.

title: openai-ergonomic: Document migration to unified Tool API
description: Write docs and changelog entries explaining how downstream projects move from the old Tool/TypedTool/StronglyTypedTool model to the new unified Tool trait and macro helpers.

title: Verify CI passes after quickstart streaming fix

title: openai-ergonomic: Add helper to replay tool call results
description: Provide a convenience helper in openai-ergonomic that takes a ToolRegistry and ChatCompletionResponseWrapper, executes pending tool calls, and appends the resulting tool messages back onto a chat request builder. This should make multi-step tool workflows easier for downstream apps (demo, etc.).

title: Cleanup unused/obsolete git branches across all repos
description: Review and cleanup unused or obsolete branches in all genai-rs repositories to maintain a clean git history and reduce clutter
design:
Expected branches to keep:
- main (primary branch)
- release-plz branch (automated releases)
- renovate/* branches (dependency updates)
- feature/* or PR-related branches (active development)

Branches to review for cleanup:
- Merged feature branches
- Stale renovate branches
- Old PR branches without corresponding issues
- Obsolete experimental branches
acceptance_criteria:
- All 10 repositories have been reviewed
- Unused local and remote branches identified
- Obsolete branches deleted (both local and remote)
- Only active development branches and standard branches remain

Verify openai-client-base examples
description: Run the documented example(s) in openai-client-base (e.g., README snippets or examples directory) and confirm they build and execute. Document any failures.
acceptance_criteria:
cargo run --example <name> (or equivalent) succeeds for each example shipped with the repo, or issues are filed for failures.
README code snippets are validated or tracked if they require additional setup.
notes: 2025-10-21: Inspected repository for runnable examples; no `examples/` targets or README code snippets present. `cargo test --doc` runs successfully but finds 0 doc tests. No runtime examples available to verify.

title: Verify openai-ergonomic examples
description: Execute the runnable examples documented in openai-ergonomic (README and examples folder). Confirm they compile and run, noting any required environment setup.
acceptance_criteria:
All example binaries build via cargo and run to completion (or failures are recorded with follow-up issues).
README snippets either compile or have tracked gaps with reproduction notes.
notes: 2025-10-21: Ran `cargo check --examples`; all examples compile. Executed `cargo run --example quickstart` with dummy `OPENAI_API_KEY`. Program completes but all API calls fail due to sandboxed network access (expected). Attempted `cargo run --example testing_patterns`; crashes because mockito cannot bind a local server under sandbox restrictions (`Operation not permitted`). Filed genai-19 to track adding graceful handling for this scenario. Remaining examples require real OpenAI credentials/network; not executed in this environment.

title: Verify langfuse-client-base examples
description: Run the Rust examples provided in langfuse-client-base (examples directory or docs). Ensure they compile against current dependencies and capture any failures.
acceptance_criteria:
cargo run --example <name> succeeds for each distributed example, or failing cases have logged issues with reproduction steps.
Docs/README code blocks noted as examples are checked or tracked if they require external services.
notes: 2025-10-21: Repository contains single example `basic_usage`. `cargo check --examples` succeeds. Running `cargo run --example basic_usage` after exporting LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY=dummy_pk and LANGFUSE_SECRET_KEY=dummy_sk prints the expected configuration details and exits successfully. No additional examples documented.

title: Verify langfuse-ergonomic examples
description: Build and run the examples referenced in langfuse-ergonomic (README Quick Start, examples directory). Confirm they work with current codebase.
acceptance_criteria:
Example binaries compile and execute, or blockers are documented with follow-up issues.
Any required credentials/config for Langfuse are noted so future runs succeed.
notes: 2025-10-21: `cargo check --examples` succeeds. Attempted `cargo run --example basic_trace` with placeholder LANGFUSE credentials; execution fails when trying to reach https://cloud.langfuse.com because outbound network/DNS is blocked in this environment. Remaining examples also require real Langfuse access, so they were not executed here.

title: Verify opentelemetry-langfuse examples
description: Run the Rust examples shipped with opentelemetry-langfuse (examples directory) to ensure they compile and export spans as documented.
acceptance_criteria:
cargo run --example <name> works for each example, or failures are documented with remediation plan.
Example configuration requirements (env vars, Langfuse keys) are recorded for repeatability.
notes: 2025-10-21: `cargo check --examples` passes for sync_simple, sync_batch, async_batch, custom_config. Ran `cargo run --example sync_simple` with placeholder Langfuse credentials; example executes until it attempts to verify traces via the Langfuse API and then fails because outbound requests are blocked in this environment. Remaining examples depend on the same API access, so they were not executed here.
